item.title: Teleport help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“twobrosplay, post:4, topic:547794”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666699.msg4457631#msg4457631 date=1415820363]
Both ways will require a timer…
[/quote]
Can you point me in the right direction of how I would go about doing this?[/quote]

Your server should have an eventhandler of some form already. That could easily act as your timer.

If not, your server also has a process method that runs every 600ms (1 server tick) which could also act as a timer.
Note: using the process method is a bad route, it should only be used as a “last-ditch” effort.

I don’t really know much about your server so I can’t exactly help too much…

What does your teleport method look like?

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well then handle the teleport better?

You’re playing the animation and gfx and then directly after you start the teleport.

Either A) Add a timer so the anim/gfx can play or B) modify your teleport code to allow start/end anims and start/end gfx and then use timers there to choose when they play and when the teleport starts.

Both ways will require a timer…

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

My guess would be that the teleporting is happening to quickly for the animation to play. I’m not sure how to fix this, but there may be some delay functionality.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport help

item.description:

Problem I’m having : I’m using the server called (dementhium) and I’m trying to add a delay code to my teleports.

My current code : [spoiler]
if (command[0].equalsIgnoreCase(“home”)) {
Player.animate(10271);
Player.graphics(1803);
Player.teleport(2664, 10081, 2); [/spoiler]

It teleports there and after you’ve reached home it animates

  • thanks for all your comments (my first post )
